Title: Associate Director, Global Clinical Supply Chain
Description:
Organizational Overview:
Immunovant, Inc. is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company dedicated to enabling normal lives for people with autoimmune diseases. As a leader in FcRn inhibitor technology, we are boldly developing innovative therapies for a range of debilitating autoimmune diseases with significant unmet patient needs. Our investigational compounds, batoclimab and IMVT-1402, are novel, fully human, monoclonal antibodies targeting the neonatal Fc receptor (FcRn). Both are optimized as a subcutaneous injection with potential flexibility in dosing and approach and are designed to reduce immunoglobin G (IgG) antibodies that cause inflammation and disease.
The Role:
The Associate Director Global Clinical Supply Chain will report to the Senior Director, Global Supply Chain. The Associate Director, Global Clinical Supply Chain possesses a good understanding of Clinical supply management, CMC, regulatory, project management terminology and demonstrates effective communication skills. The Associate Director Global Clinical Supply Chain collects and assesses information from various sources including cross-functional teams, systems, tools, and communication with functional leads. The Associate Director of Global Clinical Supply Chain is responsible for the successful execution of supply chain management for clinical trials. This role provides triage support to rapid start-up of CDMOs, CROs to enable clinical study initiation at clinical sites and on-going support of the sites including returns and reconciliation. The Associate Director, Global supply chain, partners with the Clinical Operations group and CMC group to ensure continuous supply of Investigational Medicinal Product (IMP) for Immunovant trials. Assist in the oversight of packaging and labeling vendors, distribution and set up and administering Interactive Response Technology (IRT) to supply study drug to global clinical trials using sound supply chain techniques.
Key Responsibilities: 
Managing and executing overall Project Delivery through coordination of CMC efforts assigned to the entire project team (including but not limited to CMC, Supply Chain, Legal, Procurement, Regulatory, Clinical Development, and Clinical Operations).Provides recommendations on packaging design, distribution and blinding strategy. Plans and manages execution of initial supplies and resupplies for assigned studies. Designs and implements plans to supply study drug to complex global clinical trials using sound supply chain techniques.Develops and executes inventory management plans for clinical sites and depots to ensure treatment availability for every patient visit.Interprets clinical synopsis and protocols and creates clinical forecast.Executes supply chain inventory management in partnership with Clinical operations.Proactively identifies potential supply chain issues, provides analysis and recommends solutions.Performs study close out activities including returned good reconciliation, inventory destruction processing, and file archiving.Manage the inventory and shipment logistics of all Immunovant products and associated samples. Ensures temperature excursion process is executed as required.Liaison with Suppliers to manage relationships and drive triage level activities that require diligent focus with rapid start-up, resolution to issues, and respond to questions related to CMC projects.Acts as IRT System Lead, gathers and provides input into user requirement specifications of Interactive Response Technology (IRT) management module(s) and ensures that IRT settings are adjusted to optimize the supply chain.Leverages the inventory management capabilities of the IRT to appropriately manage clinical sites and depot inventory for assigned studies.Perform all necessary tasks to ensure clinical supply chain for assigned trials operates effectively.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in science, engineering, or another relevant field; advanced degree preferred.Five-plus years of relevant pharmaceutical/biotech industry experience.Experience managing diverse project activities with contract CMO facilities at different global locations; Experience with clinical supply management.Outstanding project management skills; proven ability to work independently, prioritize, and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.Strong computer skills including MS Office and SmartSheets.Hands-on, roll-up-your-sleeves approach with high sense of urgency and drive for results.Demonstrated communication, problem-solving, leadership, and decision-making skills.Ability to think outside of the box and challenge the status quo.Natural entrepreneurial spirit with unrelenting dedication to delivering results.Desire to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment.Natural collaborator who enjoys working on a cross-functional team.
 Work Environment:
Remote basedDynamic, interactive, fast-paced, and entrepreneurial environment.Domestic or international travel are required (10-20%).
